alert.note: Alert for Carson City; Douglas; Lyon; Storey; Washoe (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 8:56AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: .Heavy rainfall will continue in lower western Nevada valleys which may result in sudden rises in small creeks and streams. Rain and snow mix is expected across foothill areas this morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following areas and independent city, Carson City, Douglas, Lyon, Storey and Washoe. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Small creek and stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban areas is possible. Standing water on roadways may result in hydroplaning hazards to motorists. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to an incoming storm system. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reno, Carson City, Gardnerville, Sparks, Gardnerville Ranchos, Johnson Lane, Carson City Airport, New Washoe City, Washoe City, Pleasant Valley, Indian Hills, Galena, Damonte Ranch, Caughlin Ranch, Hidden Valley, Reno-Tahoe International Airport,Lemmon Valley-Golden Valley, Washoe Lake Campground and Lakeview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads, and normally dry stream beds is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

area.areaDesc: Carson City; Douglas; Lyon; Storey; Washoe
